69BF482AF0C04BFB9F8A28A23B79D9C2.description: create a plan for making a major purchase (e.g., buying a computer, signing up for a cellphone package), using strategies for making informed and responsible consumer decisions

A0567A0F63964864A23DECCD28D679A9.description: describe strategies for resisting impulse buying (e.g., make a list of the items they need, eat before giving grocery shopping, plan their purchases, research the product they want)

26637E1C9C7A4F4EBA927417A850DB4C.description: describe the impact of marketing and advertising techniques (e.g., product placement, celebrity endorsement) on consumer decisions

B3135B19C21B446C8BCBDCE7ED0E767B.description: describe strategies for making informed and responsible consumer decisions (e.g., comparison shopping, reading labels and contracts, buying Canadian-made goods, checking warranties)

7E0BF8AE6D4A4D41B3E92B9858224345.description: Consumer Awareness: describe and demonstrate responsible consumer practices.

9887EBCCEB3644189D094CADBACAE7EF.description: explain how families can fulfil their functions and meet their needs while reducing their impact on the environment (e.g., by recycling and reusing goods, composting, shopping for second-hand clothing or household items, reducing consumption, using forms of transportation other than a car whenever possible)

97033752EEDC4C64BB6EFA2C586EDCE9.description: describe ways in which diverse families (e.g., families from diverse backgrounds, nuclear versus extended families, upper-class versus working-class families) perform their fundamental functions

3C2CF506ECBC490997D81113975C47F2.description: identify family functions that are common to all cultures (e.g., reproduction, socialization of children, physical maintenance of members, nurturance and love, social control, production of goods and services)

ADE286575EAD4CEAAC6A78849E82A992.description: describe a variety of family forms (e.g., nuclear, single-parent, blended, extended, same-sex, skipped-generation, foster, and adoptive families; families of affinity)

955039EA57124B93AAADF93DD0A87899.description: Family Responsibilities: describe the functions and responsibilities of families and the diverse ways in which families fulfil them;

B552337D28674AA0B3D8ACDE1C989E40.description: explain how and why an adolescent's responsibilities with respect to the family and household changes as his or her independence increases (e.g., with reference to sharing responsibilities to meet food, clothing, and household needs, and caring for and communicating with family members)

F2FE5F8B4A1048028AB732BAD1A70A51.description: explain the importance of taking personal responsibility for maintaining their health and well-being (e.g., how taking personal responsibility contributes to skills development, independence, self-confidence)

89C4830BA2B1411FA79C5BAA4C47D49D.description: identify strategies and resources that individuals can use to improve and/or maintain their personal health and well-being (e.g., resources such as Canada's Food Guide and other Health Canada publications; strategies such as practising good hygiene, exercising, spending time in nature, managing stress, choosing healthy foods, living within their means, fostering healthy relationships; avoiding unsafe practices such as drinking and driving, smoking, having unprotected sex)

E15D30B3629D438BA2D4C9C3900F1EED.description: Personal Responsibilities: demonstrate an understanding of their responsibilities related to their personal well-being and that of their family, and of how they can maintain their health and well-being;

048DF97E252947FAAC229A375457BEF2.description: describe factors that can affect the design of living spaces, and demonstrate the practical knowledge and skills required to help create and sustain a healthy and functional living space (e.g., the ability to choose environmentally friendly technology and materials, to decorate on a budget, to apply elements and principles of design, to construct a home accessory from new or recycled components)

5E523705E9EB42BDACE8EF9DDC7243A0.description: describe criteria used in wardrobe planning, and demonstrate the practical knowledge and skills required to meet their clothing needs (e.g., an understanding of apparel and textile care symbols; the ability to care for clothing made from various types of fabric, to choose a practical and affordable wardrobe, to mend a garment, to construct and/or alter a garment, to locate budget and second-hand clothing stores)

099974B5F2D549768E528BF34438B025.description: describe the elements of a healthy diet, and demonstrate the practical knowledge and skills required to prepare healthy meals and snacks (e.g., the ability to plan varied, nutritious, and economical meals and snacks; an understanding of healthy cooking methods; an understanding of the guidelines in Canada's Food Guide, including the First Nations, Inuit, and Métis version and the translated versions of Canada's Food Guide; the ability to follow recipes and to interpret food labels; skills related to food presentation)

CF403C258BBA46A5A7E192DCEA835F34.description: describe and demonstrate appropriate procedures that contribute to household safety (e.g., safe procedures for working with household chemicals and kitchen appliances, preparing and storing food, sewing, communicating with others on the Internet, caring for young children; what to do in case of fire; precautions to ensure their personal safety when they are home alone)

2DDBFC7AFB124C2084189A164092CF82.description: Practical Skills: demonstrate an understanding of practical skills and knowledge needed to safely and effectively perform day-to-day tasks that help meet their needs and those of the family.

802EB39F59524084B52F0EE9E0B10D02.description: identify resources within their community that are available to support the needs of individuals and families (e.g., parks and playgrounds; libraries; recreation centres; walk-in clinics and hospitals; food banks; employment services; phone lines, websites, and centres to help teens)

E2FCD59C78A04D68BCE7A9105E9B75CB.description: describe and demonstrate financial strategies and the financial literacy skills necessary to manage financial resources to meet personal and family financial goals (e.g., create a budget, develop personal banking skills, save for a major purchase, regulate credit card use)

452E316707304C799EE8C28505E7E7DB.description: apply effective strategies for managing time to achieve individual, family, and group goals (e.g., prioritizing; setting daily, weekly, and monthly goals; clearly communicating divisions of labour within a family or group; identifying resources needed to achieve goals and organizing them logically with respect to time considerations)

FEB3610CF6A54FEBACDBFAF4D77957BD.description: identify family resources (e.g., time, knowledge, money, skills, talents) and describe how they can be used to meet the needs of the family unit and its individual members

CF782ECE8F5848A7BC818BD1B1422785.description: Managing Resources: demonstrate an understanding of strategies and skills that can be used to manage resources to meet the needs of the family and its individual members;

0DD574F19B5C440095C7A69959571846.description: demonstrate individual and collaborative problem-solving skills that could be applied in situations involving family, peers, or members of the community (e.g., to resolve a disagreement with a parent, when participating in a group project, when preparing for a difficult test, to resist peer pressure)

AB3FC68892E9462488CC8D361125C95E.description: identify and use effective decision-making strategies (e.g., identify effective decision-making models, reflect on the results of past decisions) to make sound decisions related to their own well-being and that of their family

76BE91A5E0974ACABE8F7F7152119267.description: Decision Making and Problem Solving: demonstrate the ability to apply decision-making and problem-solving strategies and skills, particularly within a family context;

6E32E58610E14A00A6AFBCCF00AEBBDF.description: describe differences in lifestyle among families from diverse backgrounds (e.g., food choices; social life; gender roles; family celebrations and traditions; views on health and wellness; religious expression)

73B94BF1E6D645B6B1E3C194CDA64D7F.description: describe the impact of change, including social, economic, technological, and environmental change, on the lifestyles of past and present families (e.g., the effects of changes in divorce rates, the participation of women in the workforce, the role of fathers, gender roles, household technology; generational shifts in parental perceptions about appropriate levels of involvement with and protection of children; the impact of resource depletion on families who live on the land; the rise of the skills-based economy)

33031CCAC9394817ACC14999D2EBDD18.description: Family Lifestyles: describe lifestyles in diverse families and the impact of a range of factors, including social and cultural factors, on these lifestyles.

99A4BBCAA8934FDDAFD590E4B9066F15.description: describe and demonstrate socially appropriate verbal and non-verbal communication skills in a variety of situations (e.g., describe the importance of maintaining eye contact when talking with a friend; show respect for the opinions of others in classroom discussions; using role play, demonstrate how to listen attentively when talking with parents or caregivers, or how to speak confidently during a job interview)

6E4D208A6FCA4369914F87010B1CF256.description: identify resources and strategies that can be used to help develop healthy relationships and resolve conflict in a variety of human interactions (e.g., assertiveness training, anti-bullying programs, strategies for developing empathy)

8B862E12C9DA4C68A10741BF9A530A39.description: describe the characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships (e.g., healthy relationships: trust, mutual support, clear limits and boundaries, humour, honesty; unhealthy relationships: mistrust, jealousy, isolation, control, tension)

F13D5EEC839A402CA2F36A5356AB6F15.description: describe various types of relationships in which adolescents are involved (e.g., relationships with family, friends, and people in the local community; collegial, intimate, and sexual relationships)

DE95C3B2AFBF4E9C9A934D3332413D38.description: Relating to Others: demonstrate an understanding of various types of relationships and of skills and strategies for developing and maintaining healthy relationships;

CD50F8C71BF04F8CA691A6CD72DCB552.description: explain the connection between adolescents' developmental needs and their individual behaviour (e.g., how identity development and the corresponding need to belong to a group can affect social behaviours; how rapid physical development affects behaviours related to sleep and diet)

7F7B820074AF4D35AB5806009044E78B.description: distinguish between needs and wants, and identify needs, wants, values, and goals that may develop during adolescence (e.g., needs/ wants with respect to food, exercise, friends, support from family, electronic goods, designer clothing; values as reflected in tangible goods such as clothing and cars or intangibles such as behaviour, opinions, traits; short- and long-term goals relating to relationships, education, work, money, family)

A424E6CE7C154C009B7426E1A7FE737F.description: describe important aspects of adolescent development (e.g., with reference to physical, cognitive, social, emotional development)

FC86F4FB933F41D4820B73FA622DD9C4.description: Adolescent Development: describe important changes that are associated with adolescent development, and explain their influence on the behaviour and needs of young people;

4E767B34A2AC4ABD8770F67C8A40D5DF.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

D7FDBBDA0FBA4B39A214AE46A6EB0523.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style)

F9E336D2FB544C48AC045FFD839BCF26.description: use terms relating to individual and family needs and resources correctly (e.g., abstract thinking, identity development, support, boundaries, empathy, division of labour, needs, wants, rights, resources, budget, credit card, line of credit)

94A3CCDEC0D843C5B3E887DA3B2EEFD5.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, podcast, brochure, poster, report, multimedia presentation, web page) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

D43CD31B05684ED3ADCB444EBEDA35AA.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills.

C04773CD24D14B8FB924C52722BA268C.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., weigh and connect information to determine the answer to the research question)

D5739AA1932E48338D957932CF4E7CAE.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

6A0CB53B46EA48DFA855401EFCF32C8C.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare results of surveys and interviews; determine whether common themes arise in sources)

7F4857059804486DBAA90AA783279C82.description: record and organize information and key ideas using various formats (e.g., notes, graphic organizers, summaries, audio/visual/digital records)

1B5DEFB0D6A44961B8BD87FCBA644C8F.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

5B26EFD9CAF4487DA33E8EB4023508F6.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry;

3CA23388235C4762BD81D3D344E9AFBF.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or research question, and use it to focus their research

BFC60F79C8E04418A7D7F42F8A8FA573.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., informal interviews and surveys, observations, grocery bills) and/or secondary sources (e.g., textbooks, newspaper and magazine articles, websites, government reports)

BE7F9B6050B848BAB99638F53EBFAB58.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., identify sources of information, develop research tools such as surveys or questionnaires), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

B84BD865B3DF487D903AD3B93024FD81.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate research and inquiry methods;

9D35CCCEFF8A42F3A2CD865FAE60A3E2.description: formulate effective questions to refine their research and inquiry

B00F5AA24FCD44819C627874575C2A15.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their selected topics

AEE5B9C63F1240A3858DB9F06F8236FA.description: explore a variety of topics related to individual and family needs and resources (e.g., healthy relationships, adolescent development, communication skills, lifestyle differences between generations, peer pressure, financial literacy) to identify topics for research and inquiry

B20C56ABDFE342C2888187CD9A297320.description: Exploring: explore topics related to individual and family needs and resources, and formulate questions to guide their research;
